  8 
  9 module Icalendar
 10   # A Event calendar component is a grouping of component
 11   # properties, and possibly including Alarm calendar components, that
 12   # represents a scheduled amount of time on a calendar. For example, it
 13   # can be an activity; such as a one-hour long, department meeting from
 14   # 8:00 AM to 9:00 AM, tomorrow. Generally, an event will take up time
 15   # on an individual calendar.
 16   class Event < Component
 17     ical_component :alarms
 18 
 19     ## Single instance properties
 20 
 21     # Access classification (PUBLIC, PRIVATE, CONFIDENTIAL...)
 22     ical_property :ip_class 
 23 
 24     # Date & time of creation
 25     ical_property :created
 26 
 27     # Complete description of the calendar component
 28     ical_property :description
 29 
 30     # Specifies date-time when calendar component begins
 31     ical_property :dtstart, :start
 32 
 33     # Latitude & longitude for specified activity
 34     ical_property :geo, :geo_location
 35  
 36     # Date & time this item was last modified
 37     ical_property :last_modified
 38 
 39     # Specifies the intended venue for this activity
 40     ical_property :location
 41 
 42     # Defines organizer of this item
 43     ical_property :organizer
 44 
 45     # Defines relative priority for this item (1-9... 1 = best)
 46     ical_property :priority
 47 
 48     # Indicate date & time when this item was created
 49     ical_property :dtstamp, :timestamp
 50 
 51     # Revision sequence number for this item
 52     ical_property :seq, :sequence
 53 
 54     # Defines overall status or confirmation of this item
 55     ical_property :status
 56     ical_property :summary
 57     ical_property :transp, :transparency
 58 
 59     # Defines a persistent, globally unique id for this item
 60     ical_property :uid, :unique_id
 61 
 62     # Defines a URL associated with this item
 63     ical_property :url
 64     ical_property :recurid, :recurrence_id
 65 
 66     ## Single but mutually exclusive properties (Not testing though)
 67     
 68     # Specifies a date and time that this item ends
 69     ical_property :dtend, :end
 70 
 71     # Specifies a positive duration time
 72     ical_property :duration
 73 
 74     ## Multi-instance properties
 75 
 76     # Associates a URI or binary blob with this item
 77     ical_multi_property :attach, :attachment, :attachments
 78 
 79     # Defines an attendee for this calendar item
 80     ical_multi_property :attendee, :attendee, :attendees
 81     
 82     # Defines the categories for a calendar component (school, work...)
 83     ical_multi_property :categories, :category, :categories
 84 
 85     # Simple comment for the calendar user.
 86     ical_multi_property :comment, :comment, :comments
 87 
 88     # Contact information associated with this item.
 89     ical_multi_property :contact, :contact, :contacts
 90     ical_multi_property :exdate, :exception_date, :exception_dates
 91     ical_multi_property :exrule, :exception_rule, :exception_rules
 92     ical_multi_property :rstatus, :request_status, :request_statuses
 93 
 94     # Used to represent a relationship between two calendar items
 95     ical_multi_property :related_to, :related_to, :related_tos
 96     ical_multi_property :resources, :resource, :resources
 97 
 98     # Used with the UID & SEQUENCE to identify a specific instance of a
 99     # recurring calendar item.
100     ical_multi_property :rdate, :recurrence_date, :recurrence_dates
101     ical_multi_property :rrule, :recurrence_rule, :recurrence_rules
102     
103     def initialize()
104       super("VEVENT")
105 
106       sequence 0
107       timestamp DateTime.now
108     end
109 
110     def alarm(&block)
111       a = Alarm.new
112       self.add a
113 
114       a.instance_eval &block if block
115 
116       a
117     end
118 
119 
120   end
121 end
